title: Home
text:
I am Wong Zi Xin, a Year 3 undergraduate student double majoring in Psychology and Communications and New Media at the National University of Singapore. I am particularly interested in children’s moral development, and am currently a part of the NUS Child Development Lab where we look at moral behaviour in children. I aspire to work in a field directly related to children in the future!








To share a little more about myself, I love cafe hopping with my friends and dancing in my free time when I am not caught up with school work and commitments. Some of the cafes on my list to explore include September Coffee and Nesuto. I also love travelling, and some countries on my bucket list are Nepal, Italy and Vietnam. I recently visited Kyoto and Osaka over the summer break, and miss the delicious food there!



I created this website as part of my project for my NM2207 module, and am excited to share my creations with what I have learnt in class! I will soon be starting on my data story project, stay tuned for the end product!

title: NM2207 Weekly Codes
text:
Click on any one of the folders below to see what I have been doing and have learnt in each week of class! Each folder contains the data sets I have used, the Code Along practices and Challenge submissions for each week. From Week 9 onward, diary entries logging the progress for my Final Project will be in the folders.

title: Data Story
text:
First, I was interested in finding out about the yearly number of passengers travelling by air in the European Union region. I was particularly interested in looking at how much the numbers have dwindled since the outbreak of the pandemic, and how much air travel picked up in a post COVID world.





From this line graph, it is evident that there is a steady increase in the number of air travel passengers since 2011, up till the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2019. From 2019-2020, the number of passengers decreased sharply. Following the opening up of borders again from 2020 onwards, there was a gradual increase in the number of passengers again in 2021, and a sharper increase from 2021-2022.

title: Data Story
text:
First, I was interested in finding out about the yearly number of passengers travelling by air in the European Union region. I was particularly interested in looking at how much the numbers have dwindled since the outbreak of the pandemic, and how much air travel picked up in a post COVID world.





From this line graph, it is evident that there is a steady increase in the number of air travel passengers since 2011, up till the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2019. From 2019-2020, the number of passengers decreased sharply. Following the opening up of borders again from 2020 onwards, there was a gradual increase in the number of passengers again in 2021, and a sharper increase from 2021-2022.

title: Resources
text:
This article discusses the critical role of mobility and transport in the socio-economic framework of our society, emphasising how these factors contribute to social connections and access to essential services. It underlines the challenge of adapting the current mobility system to meet the increasing demands of a growing population. This necessitates innovative solutions for sustainable expansion.



This report dives into great detail the contributions of the aviation industry on different sectors in society. It particularly focuses on anlaysing the economic benefits brought about by the aviation industry, with data visualisations on trends over the years across countries worldwide.



This report highlights how the outbreak of the pandemic impacted various aspects of the aviation industry amid lock downs and travel restrictions. Notable key points from the report include the economic performance of the aviation value chain. During the pandemic, the aviation industry faced massive losses, with airlines incurring the most significant financial damage—USD 175 billion in 2020 and USD 104 billion in 2021.



This article concisely summarises trends in international tourism and how the outbreak of the pandemic impacted this sector. It is an easy read that incorporates many data visualisation graphs to get its key points across.
